enables your organization to anticipate and respond to your customers expectations in ways that may not have

defines how business and IT align and operate to reach strategic business

engineering in operations and we'll talk a little bit about the different operating models and you'll see how we
how we look at this when we come to the next couple of slides but ultimately
your operating model affects your migration path to AWS we find that the
business objectives break into a few different categories you've got your sustain category this is
really about applications that eventually are going to be sunset or replaced by something else
you've got undifferentiated or commoditized capabilities you're doing minimal investment here
what's IT doing they're keeping the lights on at this point and this is appropriate for the sort of re host
applications that you see really we often see a very traditional operating
model in this space for optimized objectives well these are the capabilities that run your core business
functions things like s ap other systems central to your business IT here what's
IT focused on resiliency availability security scalability those sorts of
basic concepts really optimizing the platform as they go then you've got the grow section down at the bottom this is
really about the capabilities that are the future of your business or your organization this is where you're
gaining market share this is where you're entering new markets this is where you're launching digital capabilities
what's IT doing their IT is trying to get out of the way and allow the business to experiment and move as

which are migration paths into AWS so
what do we see commonly within enterprises we see operating models that look like this operating models that
generally have separate teams working independently from each other so if we
think about those traditional applications where we're just keeping the lights on what do we see you know
you've got a dev team perhaps you may just have the software vendor looking at that you've got cloud platform
engineering putting out basic standards and the like and then
you might have an MSP or an ops team that's actually operating that platform
on a regular basis often those two sides don't talk to each other you're keeping
the lights on that's what we commonly see for those sustained type of apps for optimized apps you've you know you've

and then again you've got a cloud platform engineering team sometimes they cut across operations sometimes they

team and the DevOps team tends to cover the application engineering in the operations but they tend not to do a lot
on the platform side so the question is do these operating models work and the
answer is from our point of view and in the experience we've had with our customers and from the feedback we get
none of these are optimal for any one of these approaches what do we like to see
what do we recommend so in the sustain space what do we recommend a much
